docs.snippet: International Olympic Committee (IOC) President Thomas Bach travelled to Pyongyang on Thursday, the Olympic body said, in a visit that comes after North Korea's participation in the Pyeongchang Winter Games helped ease inter-Korean relations.

headline.print_headline: IOC Chief Bach Arrives to North Korea, to Stay Until Saturday
headline.main: IOC Chief Bach Arrives to North Korea, to Stay Until Saturday

docs.snippet: A summit on April 27 will be only the third time that the leaders of the divided Koreas have met in the 65 years since the end of the Korean War.

headline.print_headline: Kim, Moon Summit Would Be the Third Between Divided Koreas
headline.main: Kim, Moon Summit Would Be the Third Between Divided Koreas

docs.snippet: The census is scrapping new categories for Hispanics and Arab-Americans while adding a citizenship question to drive more of them into the shadows.

headline.print_headline: The Americans Our Government Won’t Count
headline.main: The Americans Our Government Won’t Count

docs.snippet: U.S. gunmaker Remington Outdoor Co Inc won court approval on Tuesday to borrow an interim $75 million to sustain its business during its Chapter 11 bankruptcy, which will allow the company to carry out a $775 million debt-cutting deal.

headline.print_headline: Gunmaker Remington Gets Approval for Loan to Carry It Through Bankruptcy
headline.main: Gunmaker Remington Gets Approval for Loan to Carry It Through Bankruptcy

docs.snippet: Eric Holder, the United States attorney general under President Barack Obama, said Facebook should be viewed as a communication company and be regulated.

headline.main: Eric Holder Speaks With The Times

docs.snippet: A former Chinese investment fund manager has lost a bid to dismiss charges by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission that he made $36 million from insider trading after being tipped about DreamWorks Animation SKG Inc's acquisition by Comcast ...

headline.print_headline: Chinese Ex-Fund Manager Must Face U.S. SEC's Insider Trading Claims: Judge
headline.main: Chinese Ex-Fund Manager Must Face U.S. SEC's Insider Trading Claims: Judge

docs.snippet: U.S. benchmark stock indexes fell sharply on Monday, undermined by weakness in the technology sector while a growing trade dispute with China has investors pulling back on concerns over economic growth.

headline.print_headline: Instant View: Stocks Tumble, Led by Tech Pullback and Trade Fears
headline.main: Instant View: Stocks Tumble, Led by Tech Pullback and Trade Fears

docs.snippet: Anti-corruption activists in Malta said on Tuesday they had written to Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras urging him to grant asylum to a Russian woman who blew the whistle on alleged wrongdoing at Malta-based Pilatus Bank.

headline.print_headline: Malta Activists Urge Greece to Grant Asylum to Whistleblower
headline.main: Malta Activists Urge Greece to Grant Asylum to Whistleblower

docs.snippet: Whether the corporate tax cut is successful depends less on how companies spend their windfall than on their investment behavior in the future, our columnist says.

headline.print_headline: How to Think About Corporate Tax Cuts
headline.main: How to Think About Corporate Tax Cuts

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's move last week to tweak his ban on transgender people joining the military might not save it from being struck down, a federal judge in Seattle suggested Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Judge Shows Scant Patience for Military Transgender Ban
headline.main: Judge Shows Scant Patience for Military Transgender Ban
